intro: Biscutella valentina subsp. flexuosa, commonly known as the flexible biscuitroot, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops and wild plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, elongated leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in racemes, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. This subspecies is adapted to rocky and arid environments, showcasing its resilience in harsh conditions.
